pageContext.claim: “[The Chinese] market is down close to 40 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: China's economy is still growing, just not at the rapid pace that it has enjoyed in recent years. (China's economy grew 6.5 percent in the third quarter of 2018, according to official data.) Chinese markets did fall in 2018. The Shanghai composite fell nearly 25 percent in 2018 and the Shenzhen composite plunged about 33 percent. But neither lost 40 percent. Plus, a stock market is not necessarily emblematic of a nation's economy.
